list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: Many trees were blown down in the gale.

list_ex_of_english: They are not allowed to undertake the essential first-aid repair works in connection with damage caused by floods or gales.

Suddenly a gale of wind blows up and the kite flies to the sky.
There was no snow, but there were gales, rain and fierce wind.
There have been more than the average number of severe gales this winter.
Given fair weather and no gales in the late summer, the apple and pear crops will be outstandingly good.
In a storm one night the lights went out and when the gale subsided the ship had vanished.
Surely such things as gales of wind and fogs occur.
